remarks: In a domain, a product is zero iff it has a zero factor.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Mar-2015.)
statement:
domneq0.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
domneq0.t $e |- .x. = ( .r ` R ) $.
domneq0.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
domneq0 $p |- ( ( R e. Domn /\ X e. B /\ Y e. B ) -> ( ( X .x. Y ) = .0. <-> ( X = .0. \/ Y = .0. ) ) ) $.
